sentence.Network_en: The shops had still a pleasant quaintness.
sentence.Network_cn: 店铺里依然弥漫着一种亲切的古雅气氛.

sentence.Network_en: She liked the old cottage; its quaintness was appealing.
sentence.Network_cn: 她喜欢那个老旧的小屋, 其奇巧的风格很吸引人.

sentence.Network_en: Some words in her dialect had a charming quaintness.
sentence.Network_cn: 她说过的带有方言的一些话中有种可爱的意趣.

She liked the old cottage ; its quaintness was appealing ., 她喜欢那个老旧的小屋 , 其奇巧的风格很吸引人.
among real chemists and materials scientists who have now become nanotechnologists , Drexier's predictions have assumed a certain quaintness ;在真正的化学和材料学专家中（他们已经变成纳米技术专家了)，德莱克斯勒的预言具有某种奇特的性质；

list.abs: though this quaint area has been tidied up , sometimes in the prissiest way , it is still one of the parts of Sydney we love most .即便这片怪异的地方已经被收拾得差不多了，多半时候谨慎说来，这里仍然是悉尼最受人青睐的地方。
looking upon this tree with its quaint pretension ., 望着这棵树它样子夸张.

on the east coast of the Cape peninsula , you can commuter train along the False Bay coastline , stopping at beaches and quaint villages .在开普半岛的东海岸，你可以乘坐佛斯湾海岸线的市郊火车，逐个停留游览沿途沙滩和独特的村庄。

entry.tran: 奇特的；古色古香的;古雅的
entry.def: Something that is quaint is attractive because it is unusual and rather old-fashioned.

example.ex: ...a small, quaint town with narrow streets and traditional half-timbered houses...
example.tran: 一座有着狭窄街道和传统的露木架房屋的古色古香的小镇

example.ex: That's how concepts like general welfare start to sound quaint in this age.
example.tran: 就这样，民众福利这一类概念在这个时代开始变得陈旧起来。

means.word_mean: 1. the quality of being quaint and old-fashioned;

sentences.sentence: "she liked the old cottage; its quaintness was appealing"

means.word_mean: 2. strangeness as a consequence of being old fashioned;

sentences.sentence: "some words in her dialect had a charming quaintness"
